name: Fiji
description: Fiji, officially the Republic of Fiji, is an archipelago nation in Melanesia, located in the South Pacific Ocean. It’s renowned for its stunning coral reefs, pristine beaches, lush rainforests, and vibrant culture. The country is comprised of more than 300 islands, with approximately 100 of them permanently inhabited. Fiji boasts a diverse ecosystem, rich biodiversity, and a warm, welcoming spirit.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The total population of Fiji is approximately 933,029 as of 2023.
quickFacts.detail: The population is concentrated on Viti Levu and Vanua Levu, the two largest islands.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Suva is the capital and largest city of Fiji.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a bustling commercial and administrative center.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Fijian is the national language, while English is widely used in government, education, and business.
quickFacts.detail: Bula is a common Fijian greeting.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The currency of Fiji is the Fijian Dollar.
quickFacts.detail: It is pegged to the New Zealand Dollar.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Fiji's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in 2023 was approximately $12.37 billion.
quickFacts.detail: Tourism and sugar production are key contributors to the economy.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Fiji enjoys a tropical climate characterized by consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is generally abundant, with distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is generally sunny and pleasant, with lower humidity and less rainfall. It’s ideal for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings increased rainfall, often in the form of tropical storms and cyclones. However, the rain is usually short-lived, and sunshine often returns quickly.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Cyclone Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Fiji is within the cyclone belt, so cyclone season is a significant factor. Residents and visitors should be aware of weather warnings and take necessary precautions.
activities: Limited outdoor activities during cyclone warnings

naturalWonders.name: Sawa-i-Lau Caves
naturalWonders.description: The Sawa-i-Lau Caves are a series of stunning limestone caves located on a remote island in the Yasawa Group. Accessible only by boat, these caves feature breathtaking blue pools and intricate formations.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The caves are believed to have been used as a sacred burial ground by the islanders for centuries. The blue color of the pools is due to the reflection of sunlight on the limestone walls.
viewingTips: Book a guided tour in advance

naturalWonders.name: Garden of the Sleeping Giant
naturalWonders.description: The Garden of the Sleeping Giant is a sprawling botanical garden showcasing the diverse flora of Fiji. It’s a peaceful oasis with stunning views of the Coral Coast.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The garden features a vast collection of native plants, including orchids, ferns, and towering trees. It’s a popular spot for birdwatching and photography.
viewingTips: Allow at least 2-3 hours to explore

naturalWonders.name: Tavoro Falls
naturalWonders.description: The Tavoro Falls are a series of three stunning waterfalls located on the island of Kadavu. The largest waterfall cascades into a beautiful lagoon, perfect for swimming.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The falls are surrounded by lush rainforest and offer a truly immersive experience. A short hike through the jungle leads to the lagoon.

ecosystemData.title: Fiji’s Diverse Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Fiji’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from pristine coral reefs to lush rainforests and volcanic mountains. The country’s isolation has contributed to the evolution of unique flora and fauna.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coral Reefs
biodiversityCategories.description: Fiji’s coral reefs are among the most diverse in the world, supporting a vast array of marine life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rainforests
biodiversityCategories.description: Fiji’s rainforests are home to a remarkable variety of plant and animal life, including many endemic species.

activities.title: Adventure & Recreation in Fiji
activities.description: Fiji offers a wide range of activities for visitors of all interests and abilities, from adrenaline-pumping adventures to relaxing beach days.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Fiji’s stunning rainforests and volcanic mountains on foot.

activities.name: Saratoga Trail Hike
activities.description: A popular hike through the rainforest to a waterfall.
activities.requirements: Good hiking shoes, water, insect repellent

activities.name: Tavoro Falls Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike to the Tavoro Falls.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Fiji’s crystal-clear waters.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Explore Fiji’s vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch some waves on Fiji’s world-class surf breaks.

clothing.summer: Lightweight cotton clothing, swimwear, sunscreen, hat
clothing.winter: Long-sleeved shirts, light jacket, rain gear
clothing.yearRound: Versatile clothing suitable for warm and humid conditions
